nodes.name: balanceOf
transfer

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params.owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params.spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Devuleve el balance de la cuenta designada en el parámetro `_owner`.

params._owner: La dirección cuyo balance se está consultando.

balanceOf(address).return: balance Balance del propietario de los fondos (_owner).

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when allowed_[_spender] == 0. To decrement allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.subtractedValue: The amount of tokens to decrease the allowance by.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when allowed_[_spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

params.addedValue: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.
params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfiere una cantidad de tokens a la dirección especificada. Esta función funciona de la misma manera que la anterior pero no contiene el parámetro `_data`. Añadido debido a razones de compatibilidad.

transfer(address,uint256,bytes).details: Transfiere la cantidad especificada de tokens a la dirección especificada. Invoca la función `tokenFallback` si el destinatario es un contrato. La transferencia de tokens falla si el receptor es un contrato pero no implementa la función `tokenFallback` o la función de respaldo para recibir fondos.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfiere una cantidad de tokens de una dirección a otra. Para poder ejecutar esta función se requiere primero que el dueño de los fondos apruebe primero que otra dirección gaste tokens de su cuenta. Para lo cual es necesario ejecutar primero la función `Approve` con la cantidad máxima de tokens que el dueño de los fondos está dispuesto a que otro gaste de su cuenta.

params.from: Dirección del dueño de los fondos.
